channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Northeastern University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Bileve: Securing Text Provenance in Large Language Models Against Spoofing with Bi-level Signature
item.description: Bileve: a novel bi-level signature secures text provenance in LLMs against spoofing, enhancing detectability and reliability via fine-grained integrity checks and coarse-grained source tracing.

item.title: Efficient Federated Learning against Heterogeneous and Non-stationary Client Unavailability
item.description: FedAWE, a novel federated learning algorithm, efficiently handles intermittent and unpredictable client availability, ensuring fast and unbiased model training.

item.title: Exploring Token Pruning in Vision State Space Models
item.description: This paper introduces a novel token pruning method for vision state space models, achieving significant computational reduction with minimal performance impact, addressing the limitations of directly …

item.title: Fast and Memory-Efficient Video Diffusion Using Streamlined Inference
item.description: Streamlined Inference, a novel training-free framework, dramatically reduces the computation and memory costs of video diffusion models without sacrificing quality, enabling high-resolution video gene…

item.title: GraphCroc: Cross-Correlation Autoencoder for Graph Structural Reconstruction
item.description: GraphCroc, a novel graph autoencoder, leverages cross-correlation to accurately reconstruct complex graph structures, outperforming self-correlation-based methods.

item.title: MatrixNet: Learning over symmetry groups using learned group representations
item.description: MatrixNet learns efficient group representations for improved deep learning on symmetry groups, achieving higher sample efficiency and generalization than existing methods.

item.title: Personalized Federated Learning via Feature Distribution Adaptation
item.description: Personalized federated learning (PFL) often struggles with data scarcity and distribution shifts. pFedFDA, a novel algorithm, tackles this by framing representation learning as a generative modeling …

item.title: Search for Efficient Large Language Models
item.description: Training-free architecture search finds optimal subnets in LLMs, boosting inference speed and slashing memory needs without retraining.
